spatial.original: Albany, Albany, New York, United States

documents.text:
<NBX>
<UNQ>007120937_00480_TXT</UNQ>
<IMID>007120937_00480</IMID>
<APID>TH-1971-32543-5948-55</APID>
<IMGSIZE>6347,4424</IMGSIZE>
<PLACE><ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">New York</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">United States</ENAMEX></PLACE>
<SBODY>SOLD FOR TAXES AND WATER RENTS
<ENAMEX TYPE="ITE.org">Whig</ENAMEX> Wilttitre, Made the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">day of in the year of our Lord one
sed and Ninety Eight</TIMEX> Between <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">E. L. Barley</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, of the first part, and
the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Auny</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">M.T. Minor</ENAMEX>
Bitursseth: That whereas, by char-
hundred and <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">thirty-five</NUMEX> of the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX>, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">April 9th, 1850</TIMEX>, entitled, "An act to provide for a supply
of water in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," and an act amendatory thereof, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">April 15th, 1854</TIMEX>, it is among other things enacted
that the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Water Commissioners</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX> "shall establish a scale of annual rents, to be charged and paid annually.
for the supply of water or for benefits resulting therefrom, to be called 'Water Rents, and apportioned to vacant lots and
<ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>;" and further, that said water rents should be, like <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State and County</ENAMEX> taxes, a lien
and lots upon which said rents are assessed. And it is further enacted that said water ren-
"shall be collected in the same manner as is or may be prescribed by law for the collection of taxes for city purposes in the
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>;" and in all respects the like proceedings shall be had by the Receiver of Taxes and the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX>
provided by law for the collection of city taxes in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>."
of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, as is or may be provided
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Ind</ENAMEX> Whereas, By chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">eighty-six</NUMEX> of the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX>, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">March 23 d, 1850</TIMEX>, entitled
"An act to provide for the assessment and collection of taxes in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," which last mentioned act is the law
purposes in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," and the proceedings to be had <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX>
the ⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨ ⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨ <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">county of Albany</ENAMEX> for the conection of city taxes in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>, referred
in the first above mentioned acts, it is among other things enacted, that "whenever any tax charged on real estate returned
to the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX>, and the interest thereon, at the rate of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">twelve per cent</NUMEX> per annum, to be computed from the
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE.non">Fifteenth day of
when</TIMEX> such tax was payable, shall remain unpaid for <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">one year</ENAMEX>
from the said <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">yesterday</TIMEX> of
at the <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said County</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> shall proceed to advertise
and sell such real estate in the manner herein provided,
vided for the payment of such tax and interest, and the expenses of such
lists and notices, and of conducting the sale, shall be added to the tax and interest.
sale. The expense of publishing lists at
Mud Whereas, Default was made in the payment of the taxes and water rents legally charged upon sundry
parcels or lots of real estate among which were the premises hereinafter described, returned to the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX> with the
interest thereon, which said taxes and water rents and interest had remained unpaid for <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">one year</ENAMEX> from the
day of following the time when such taxes and water rents were payable.
and Whereas, The <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, for the time being, in virtue of the power in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">him</ENAMEX> vested.
and after due notice for that purpose published according to law, did sell at public auction, at the <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">City Hall</ENAMEX>, in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of
Albany</ENAMEX>, on the
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">day of in the year of our Lord one thousand eight
hundred</TIMEX> and
each of the said parcels or lots of real estate so as aforesaid charged with taxes and
water rents and interest remaining unpaid, for the lowest term of years at which any person offered to take the same in
consideration of advancing the sum necessary to discharge the taxes and water rents, interest and expenses aforesaid due
thereon at the time of sale.
And Whereas, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lawrence R. Keife Jr</ENAMEX>
became the purchaser, at such sale, of the following parcel or lot of real estate situate in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>, for the term
of <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">One Thousand years</ENAMEX>, or the sum of five
with the interest and expenses due thereon at the time of such tham Property on the North side of <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Wash</ENAMEX>
are between <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Partridge and Erie Streets</ENAMEX>, Street No
Map No, 43 being <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">33</NUMEX> feet front and <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">172</NUMEX> feet in depth, and
bounded on the North by <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Benson st South</ENAMEX> by <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Wash ave East</ENAMEX>
by <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Reed</ENAMEX> and West by <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Reed</ENAMEX>
which said parcel or lot of real estate was sold at said sale
the under and by virtue of the said chapter 235 of the Laws of
amendatory thereto, and of
the said chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">eighty-six</NUMEX> of
the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX> passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">March 2nd, 1856</TIMEX>, and Chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">four hundred and eighty-six</NUMEX> of said Laws amende-
tory thereof, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">July 10th, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty-one</TIMEX>, entitled, "An act to amend
" and Chapter <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART">298 of ththe acts</ENAMEX> relating to the <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">two</NUMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE.non">March 2nd</TIMEX>, and put it
And Whereas, be for the term aforesaid, has not been redeemed within the <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">two years</ENAMEX> prescribed by law for the redemption thereof.
And whereas.
How, Wherefore. The said party of the first part, by virtue of the authority vested in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">him</ENAMEX> by law, and for and
in consideration of the premises and of the sum of
<NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">dollars and
cents</NUMEX> paid as aforesaid to
the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, hath granted, bargained, sold, conveyed and released, and by these presents doth
grant, bargain, sell, convey and release to the said part of the second part, and to for <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX> for the term
aforesaid, the said parcel or lot of real estate above described, with the hereditaments and appurtenances to the same
belonging. To have and to hold the same to the said part of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, for the term of
years aforesaid; subject, how
In witness adherent. The said party of the first part, as <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>
for the time being, hath hereunto set <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> hand and seal the <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">day and year
first above written</TIMEX>.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">E.L.</ENAMEX> - - -
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Philip State of Hem Hort</ENAMEX>,
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">CITY AND COUNTY OF ALBANY</ENAMEX>.
On this <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">187</TIMEX> before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX>, the subscriber, a
Comm of Deeds
residing in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City and County of Albany</ENAMEX>, appeared
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, and acknowledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX> had
executed the within instrument. And <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> further certify that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> know the person <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> made the said acknowledgment to be
the individual described in and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">H. H. Bender</ENAMEX>
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">August 1877</TIMEX> Court of Deeds
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">my</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">PEW Cabe Clerk</ENAMEX>.
</SBODY>
</NBX>

On this <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">187</TIMEX> before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX>, the subscriber, a
Comm of Deeds
residing in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City and County of Albany</ENAMEX>, appeared
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, and acknowledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX> had
executed the within instrument. And <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> further certify that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> know the person <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> made the said acknowledgment to be
the individual described in and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">H. H. Bender</ENAMEX>
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">August 1877</TIMEX> Court of Deeds
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">my</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">PEW Cabe Clerk</ENAMEX>.
</SBODY>

<NBX>
<UNQ>007120937_00480_TXT</UNQ>
<IMID>007120937_00480</IMID>
<APID>TH-1971-32543-5948-55</APID>
<IMGSIZE>6347,4424</IMGSIZE>
<PLACE><ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">New York</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">United States</ENAMEX></PLACE>
<SBODY>SOLD FOR TAXES AND WATER RENTS
<ENAMEX TYPE="ITE.org">Whig</ENAMEX> Wilttitre, Made the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">day of in the year of our Lord one
sed and Ninety Eight</TIMEX> Between <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">E. L. Barley</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, of the first part, and
the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Auny</ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">M.T. Minor</ENAMEX>
Bitursseth: That whereas, by char-
hundred and <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">thirty-five</NUMEX> of the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX>, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">April 9th, 1850</TIMEX>, entitled, "An act to provide for a supply
of water in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," and an act amendatory thereof, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">April 15th, 1854</TIMEX>, it is among other things enacted
that the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Water Commissioners</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX> "shall establish a scale of annual rents, to be charged and paid annually.
for the supply of water or for benefits resulting therefrom, to be called 'Water Rents, and apportioned to vacant lots and
<ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>;" and further, that said water rents should be, like <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State and County</ENAMEX> taxes, a lien
and lots upon which said rents are assessed. And it is further enacted that said water ren-
"shall be collected in the same manner as is or may be prescribed by law for the collection of taxes for city purposes in the
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>;" and in all respects the like proceedings shall be had by the Receiver of Taxes and the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX>
provided by law for the collection of city taxes in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>."
of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, as is or may be provided
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Ind</ENAMEX> Whereas, By chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">eighty-six</NUMEX> of the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX>, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">March 23 d, 1850</TIMEX>, entitled
"An act to provide for the assessment and collection of taxes in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," which last mentioned act is the law
purposes in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>," and the proceedings to be had <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX>
the ⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨ ⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨⌨ <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">county of Albany</ENAMEX> for the conection of city taxes in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said city</ENAMEX>, referred
in the first above mentioned acts, it is among other things enacted, that "whenever any tax charged on real estate returned
to the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX>, and the interest thereon, at the rate of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">twelve per cent</NUMEX> per annum, to be computed from the
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE.non">Fifteenth day of
when</TIMEX> such tax was payable, shall remain unpaid for <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">one year</ENAMEX>
from the said <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">yesterday</TIMEX> of
at the <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF.loc">said County</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> shall proceed to advertise
and sell such real estate in the manner herein provided,
vided for the payment of such tax and interest, and the expenses of such
lists and notices, and of conducting the sale, shall be added to the tax and interest.
sale. The expense of publishing lists at
Mud Whereas, Default was made in the payment of the taxes and water rents legally charged upon sundry
parcels or lots of real estate among which were the premises hereinafter described, returned to the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">County Treasurer</ENAMEX> with the
interest thereon, which said taxes and water rents and interest had remained unpaid for <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">one year</ENAMEX> from the
day of following the time when such taxes and water rents were payable.
and Whereas, The <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, for the time being, in virtue of the power in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">him</ENAMEX> vested.
and after due notice for that purpose published according to law, did sell at public auction, at the <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">City Hall</ENAMEX>, in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of
Albany</ENAMEX>, on the
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">day of in the year of our Lord one thousand eight
hundred</TIMEX> and
each of the said parcels or lots of real estate so as aforesaid charged with taxes and
water rents and interest remaining unpaid, for the lowest term of years at which any person offered to take the same in
consideration of advancing the sum necessary to discharge the taxes and water rents, interest and expenses aforesaid due
thereon at the time of sale.
And Whereas, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lawrence R. Keife Jr</ENAMEX>
became the purchaser, at such sale, of the following parcel or lot of real estate situate in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City of Albany</ENAMEX>, for the term
of <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">One Thousand years</ENAMEX>, or the sum of five
with the interest and expenses due thereon at the time of such tham Property on the North side of <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Wash</ENAMEX>
are between <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Partridge and Erie Streets</ENAMEX>, Street No
Map No, 43 being <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">33</NUMEX> feet front and <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">172</NUMEX> feet in depth, and
bounded on the North by <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Benson st South</ENAMEX> by <ENAMEX TYPE="STRUCTURE">Wash ave East</ENAMEX>
by <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Reed</ENAMEX> and West by <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Reed</ENAMEX>
which said parcel or lot of real estate was sold at said sale
the under and by virtue of the said chapter 235 of the Laws of
amendatory thereto, and of
the said chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">eighty-six</NUMEX> of
the Laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">State of New York</ENAMEX> passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">March 2nd, 1856</TIMEX>, and Chapter <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">four hundred and eighty-six</NUMEX> of said Laws amende-
tory thereof, passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">July 10th, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty-one</TIMEX>, entitled, "An act to amend
" and Chapter <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART">298 of ththe acts</ENAMEX> relating to the <NUMEX TYPE="QUANTITY">two</NUMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> passed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE.non">March 2nd</TIMEX>, and put it
And Whereas, be for the term aforesaid, has not been redeemed within the <ENAMEX TYPE="DURATANNIV">two years</ENAMEX> prescribed by law for the redemption thereof.
And whereas.
How, Wherefore. The said party of the first part, by virtue of the authority vested in <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">him</ENAMEX> by law, and for and
in consideration of the premises and of the sum of
<NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">dollars and
cents</NUMEX> paid as aforesaid to
the <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, hath granted, bargained, sold, conveyed and released, and by these presents doth
grant, bargain, sell, convey and release to the said part of the second part, and to for <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX> for the term
aforesaid, the said parcel or lot of real estate above described, with the hereditaments and appurtenances to the same
belonging. To have and to hold the same to the said part of the second part, <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">heirs</ENAMEX> and <ENAMEX TYPE="NONFAMILY">assigns</ENAMEX>, for the term of
years aforesaid; subject, how
In witness adherent. The said party of the first part, as <ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>
for the time being, hath hereunto set <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> hand and seal the <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">day and year
first above written</TIMEX>.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">E.L.</ENAMEX> - - -
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Philip State of Hem Hort</ENAMEX>,
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">CITY AND COUNTY OF ALBANY</ENAMEX>.
On this <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">187</TIMEX> before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX>, the subscriber, a
Comm of Deeds
residing in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City and County of Albany</ENAMEX>, appeared
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, and acknowledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX> had
executed the within instrument. And <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> further certify that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> know the person <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> made the said acknowledgment to be
the individual described in and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">H. H. Bender</ENAMEX>
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">August 1877</TIMEX> Court of Deeds
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">my</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">PEW Cabe Clerk</ENAMEX>.
</SBODY>
</NBX>

for the time being, hath hereunto set <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">his</ENAMEX> hand and seal the <TIMEX TYPE="COREF.dat">day and year
first above written</TIMEX>.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">E.L.</ENAMEX> - - -
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Philip State of Hem Hort</ENAMEX>,
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">CITY AND COUNTY OF ALBANY</ENAMEX>.
On this <TIMEX TYPE="DATE">187</TIMEX> before <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">me</ENAMEX>, the subscriber, a
Comm of Deeds
residing in the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">City and County of Albany</ENAMEX>, appeared
<ENAMEX TYPE="OCCUPATION">Treasurer</ENAMEX> of the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">County of Albany</ENAMEX>, and acknowledged that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">he</ENAMEX> had
executed the within instrument. And <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> further certify that <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">I</ENAMEX> know the person <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> made the said acknowledgment to be
the individual described in and <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">who</ENAMEX> executed the within instrument.
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">H. H. Bender</ENAMEX>
<TIMEX TYPE="DATE">August 1877</TIMEX> Court of Deeds
<ENAMEX TYPE="LOCALE">Albany</ENAMEX> <ENAMEX TYPE="COREF">my</ENAMEX>
<ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">PEW Cabe Clerk</ENAMEX>.
